pullRequest.body:
If A is a commutative R-algebra and S is a submonoid of R then A[1/S] is an R[1/S]-algebra. The structure morphism R[1/S] -> A[1/S] is defined using a lifting property, and in particular if `A = R` it turns out to be not defeq to `algebra.id R`, so I've not made it an instance. In a proof I'm about to embark on, I'll probably be switching it on locally.

To avoid diamonds, I've had to remove the irreducibility tag from `OreLocalization.smul` , `OreLocalization.one` and `OreLocalization.npow`. This change seems to make the code base cleaner (I removed some `unseal`s and added no `seal`s), so I removed all the other ones as well. This has resulted in a slowdown in one file upstream; I isolate the problem in #16746 . 

---

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [95ca82ab9b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16650/commits/95ca82ab9bb1c41634f2e91f214d514950baea90)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.OreLocalization.Algebra`|564|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ add_def`
`+ algebra`
`+ instCommMonoid'`
`+ instCommSemiring'`
`+ instOne'`
`+ instance : Mul (A[S⁻¹])`
`+ left_distrib'`
`+ mul`
`+ mul_def`
`+ on`
`+ one_def'`
`+ smul_def`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/bca1ae5c-5cfe-469c-b89c-053650bf3ba4) for commit ba5eb3f45399919b9caea584950d64abda92db83.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/2412061d-463c-4018-a18e-93928e459aad/to/bca1ae5c-5cfe-469c-b89c-053650bf3ba4) against commit 7b6e74c18e45143bfae146336789c5e7f9a971c6:
```diff
  Benchmark                                 Metric         Change
  ========================================================================
- open Mathlib                              wall-clock       6.8% (24.3 σ)
- ~Mathlib.Algebra.Module.LocalizedModule   instructions     8.0%
```
I don't need this code any more, I only need these ideas in the commutative case and I'd misunderstood how to do this.
I'm thinking instances should have the `inst` prefix
OK, name fixed :-) It was an instance until Eric pointed out diamond possibilities and then I found one. It's the example at the bottom of the file. Can I make this defeq somehow?
You're going to want to add a copyright header

pullRequest.title: feat: Ore localization of a commutative algebra is an algebra.
